hypothesis_content.title: Volatility Compression Breakout Momentum
hypothesis_content.statement: Following a period of extreme volatility compression (20-day realized volatility below 10th percentile) in a NEUTRAL regime, a breakout above the 20-day Bollinger Band (2 std) on expanding volume (>1.5x 20-day average) signals the start of a sustained directional move, with momentum persisting for 5-10 days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Extended low volatility in neutral markets represents pent-up energy and indecision. A high-conviction breakout on volume suggests a resolution of this equilibrium, often leading to a short-term trend as new information is priced in. This is a classic 'squeeze' play.
entry_conditions: BTC 20-day realized volatility < 10th percentile of its 1-year rolling history

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price reaches entry price + (3 * 20-day ATR at entry)

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Mean return of the strategy over the 10-day hold period is not statistically significantly greater than zero after accounting for transaction costs and volatility, or the win rate is below 55% in backtests across multiple compression events.
